text: The Type-10 Defender is a mighty glacier; slow, heavily armored, and even more heavily armed, it bears the highest armor rating and theoretical damage in the game. In spite of this, the Type-10 is something of a paradox. When compared to similar ships in its price range(the Anaconda, Imperial Cutter and Federal Corvette), the Type-10 has the best armor, but the worst shielding. It has the best theoretical damage in the game, but wide hardpoint placement makes it impossible to effectively use fixed weapons. The ship's huge number of hardpoints seems ideal for turreted weapons, but hardpoint placement means all turrets can only be brought to bear when a target is directly in front of the ship. It has the rare ability to mount a class 8 shield, but less than half the shield capacity of the Cutter, and no ability to mount a class 8 Shield Cell bank. Its improved distributor improves its capability for mining, but reduced cargo capacity equally diminishes that capability. Overall, the Type-10 requires a very different design methodology from other large combat ships. Attempting to use fixed weapons, or to force the ship to rely heavily on shields, will often result in inferior results when compared to other alternatives. Some players equip it entirely with turrets and fly a Ship Launched Fighter, but this, too, is generally relegated to limited roles, such as AFK farming. Some success can be acquired by focusing on its strengths. While turreted weapons on all sides heavily diminishes damage capacity, turrets on a single side allows a player to compensate for its low maneuverability while leaving the other side for higher-damage gimballed weapons. While it shield capacity is low, its shield regeneration is undiminished, and it can take particular advantage from Guardian Shield Reinforcements, which offer nearly twice the benefit when compared to a Cutter. And with the heaviest armor in the game, it has the greatest capability to remain in a fight once its shields have gone down. Taken together, the Type 10 has the capacity to compete with other ships, though not necessarily to defeat them outright.
The Type-10 Defender is a Combat Freighter manufactured by Lakon Spaceways, produced from 3303 to Present. It costs 124,755,342 CR with an insurance value of 6,237,767 CR.

The Type-10 Defender has dimensions of 135.1m x 118.4m x 39.3m, with a hull mass of 1,200 t and a mass lock factor of 26. It has an armor rating of 1,044 with an armor hardness of 75, and shields of 99 MJ. The ship has a heat capacity of 335, a fuel capacity of 64 t, and a cargo capacity ranging from 220 t to 534 t. It has a top speed of 179 m/s (default) or 200 m/s (upgraded), a boost speed of 219 m/s (default) or 245 m/s (upgraded), and an unladen jump range of 6.97 ly (default) or 25.75 ly (upgraded). The ship has a landing pad size of Large and can accommodate 3-4 pilots with multicrew and fighter hangar capabilities.

The Type-10 Defender has 8 Utility Mounts, 2 Small Hardpoints, 3 Medium Hardpoints, and 4 Large Hardpoints. It also has a variety of internal compartments including 1 Class 1, 1 Class 2, 2 Class 3, 2 Class 4, 1 Class 5, 1 Class 6, 1 Class 7, and 1 Class 8 compartment, with 2 reserved Class 5 Military Compartments.

The Type-10 Defender's default outfitting includes Lightweight Alloys (Bulkhead, Class 1), Power Plant (Reactor Bay, Class 6, Rating E), Thrusters (Class 7, Rating E), Frame Shift Drive (Class 6, Rating E), Life Support (Environmental Control, Class 5, Rating E), Power Distributor (Class 7, Rating E), Sensors (Class 4, Rating E), and Fuel Tank (Class 6, Rating C). It also has various cargo racks and empty compartments.

The Type-10 Defender's default hardpoints include two Small Hardpoints (both empty), three Medium Hardpoints (two with Pulse Laser (L), Class 1, Rating F and one empty), and four Large Hardpoints (all empty).
